Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
David Greenberg Papers TAM 196
1.25 Linear Feet (2 boxes)
undated Materials are in English 1
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by David Greenberg in 1997. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.065.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical/Biographical Note
David F. Greenberg is the author of Crime and Capitalism: Readings in Marxist Criminology and several other books, and a professor of sociology at New York University.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; David Greenberg Papers; TAM 196; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains the manuscript of the unpublished anthology, "Behind Bars: The Prison Experiences of War Resisters," edited by David F. Greenberg and Beverly D. Houghton. The anthology contains essays by resisters to the Vietnam War regarding their experiences in various prisons and jails. The collection also includes material from the New American Movement (NAM): newspapers, internal discussion bulletins, and others.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by David Greenberg was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
